strings.Value: "What happened?"
[Silently wait for her to continue]
"I love you."
"You are my companion. Most importantly and forever."
"If you want to put an end to this, let's do it. It's over between us."
"You are my friend! And if something is getting in the way of this friendship, let's get rid of it — not each other!"
"But I'm happy with the way things are now!"
[Hug Valerie] "We're together. Now and forever."
[Kneel on one knee] "I will prove I love you. Valerie, will you marry me?"
"Too strange. We already have too many troubles and cares. Let's not complicate things."
{n}Valerie is massaging her temples with her eyes closed, like she's suffering from a terrible headache.{/n} "I've had enough. I can't do it any more."

"I've been trying so hard to come to terms with what's going on, but I can't keep doing it." {n}Valerie sighs, opens her eyes and looks at you.{/n} "I was hoping that our... arrangement wouldn't affect the rest of my life. But alas, it hasn't worked out that way!"

"I don't know who we are to each other. I am your companion — and at the same time the entire kingdom is gossiping about us! I spend my nights with you — and then in the morning we act as though we hadn't slept in the same bed!"

"I know I was the one who suggested this... but it turns out that what worked with a mercenary doesn't work with a king, where everything is always out in the open!" {n}Valerie looks straight at you.{/n} "I've had enough. I want to put an end to it. Once and for all."
{n}Valerie sighs with relief.{/n} "Yes. Of course. Duty is above everything. I started to forget that."
{n}Valerie smiles half-heartedly.{/n} "And you are my friend too. I don't want to lose you over... over some misunderstanding."
"Didn't you hear me at all?! The way things are now doesn't work for me!"

{n}Valerie inhales loudly.{/n} "Enough. Do you see me losing my head? I've no wish to take things to the edge, {name}. You know how I am when... I'm loosing my head. We need to stop seeing each other alone. Stop all this. Right now."
{n}Valerie is silent for a few moments, then scoffs in disappointment.{/n} "Now that you've said it, so easily and carelessly... I'm thinking — did I ever mean anything to you at all?"

"What are you saying?! Do you think this entire problem can be solved with some... silly... declaration..." {n}Valerie stops, stunned, as if she's just realized what she heard. She bites her lips, looking at her feet in alarm.{/n} "I..."
"I love you too."

{n}Valerie looks at you hesitantly.{/n} "But that's the thing. That's why it... hurts me so much that you and I are kind of together and not at the same time. I wouldn't care if I didn't love you." {n}Valerie shivers and holds herself as if she's freezing.{/n} "This is all so... strange."
{n}Valerie looks at you coldly, then hastily turns away and walks swiftly from your chambers.{/n}

{n}Valerie looks at you, astonished.{/n} "I never imagined.... never imagined a king proposing to me." {n}A mischievous smile appears on the girl's face.{/n} "And while you might need to work on your manners, the lack of the ring can be excused by the unusual circumstances... Yes. I will marry you. As soon as we save your kingdom."
{n}Valerie clings to you and kisses you passionately, then buries her face in your shoulder.{/n} "Together, {name}. To the end of the world."

"I'm glad we talked. I think I'll go on about my duties. We still need to defeat half the world, remember?" {n}Valerie walks out of your chambers, stopping in the doorway to cast a strange, sad look at you.{/n}
